newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish IVO says to buy stake in Hungary power co.
newsitem.headline: Finnish IVO says to buy stake in Hungary power co.

text.p: Finnish state-owned Imatran Voima (IVO) said on Friday the Hungarian privatisation agency had approved its and Japanese Tomen's bids for up to 74 percent of Hungarian power producer Budapesti Eromy Tt.
"According to the decision, a consortium formed by IVO and Japanese trading house Tomen can buy about 74 percent of the shares in Budapesti Eromy Rt," IVO said in a statement.
IVO's share would be half, or about 37 percent, it added.
"The details of the deal will be agreed during the autumn and the deal will be carried out when electricity price increases for the whole country are clear," it said.

Budapesti Eromy's five mostly gas-fuelled heat and electricity plants produce in total 250 megawatts of electricity and 2,500 megawatts of heat to power distributors and industry in the Budapest area, IVO said.

"According to IVO's studies, the large heat consumption in Budapest makes it possible to increase electricity output based on environmentally friendly and effective combined production of electricity and heat," it said.
The sale of Budapesti Eromy is part of the Hungarian privatisation programme, it said.
